author: crookeddy
text: Yeah its pretty much dead. No coin has ever recovered from a price drop like this.

author: MeherRoy
text: Peercoin is somewhat dead. Part of the trouble is a lone developer that wants to remain anonymous.

author: MarcDeMesel
text: [...] has collapsed much harder than most already, dropping from 50th place to 130th with market cap of $30M, now valued lower than dead coins like Peercoin, Namecoin and $NXT!

author: AvdiuSazan
text: [...] Only Nxt & Ardor are pure PoS. Peercoin was (dead and buried) hybrid. [...]

author: ElucTheG33K
text: And Peercoin is dead. So what the point? The banking and stock market network and computing system is using way more than Bitcoin, and building a blockchain based equivalent might cost less energy at the end as you will remove a lot of redundancy needed in a system [...]

author: BeatGrounds
text: All these alt-coins like NameCoin, PeerCoin, PrimeCoin, Franko died

author: notgrubles
text: Sorry but no. There are already PoS altcoins. Peercoin/PPCoin was the original "green" altcoin and is a dead chain. Bitcoin mining is exceedingly powered by renewables. FUD.

author: mike_g_money
text: Look at dead 1st gen alts like Peercoin and Feathercoin that pumped big in 2017

author: iambroots
text: [...] You are the one trading a trading coin that nobody is trading during a bull market where even peercoin, A coin that is a dead chain has more gains from the lows than Pria. Pria is just creating new lows. It’s dead.

author: hus_qy
text: [...] Any PoS Blockchain usually uses a classical consensus algorithm with formal math proofs for consensus. The only PoS protocols that still use on-chain PoS are Nxt and Peercoin which are both essentially dead.

author: ab
text: I wish I knew! I invested in all sorts of hyped stuff in the past that's now dead junk (Peercoin, etc). [...]
